text: {{Infobox writer | name = Dolores Claman | birth_name= Dolores Olga Claman | image = | caption = | birth_date = | birth_place = Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada | death_date = | death_place = Spain | nationality = Canadian | occupation = Composer, pianist }} Dolores Claman (July 6, 1927 - July 17, 2021) was a Canadian composer and pianist. She was best known for composing the theme song, known simply as The Hockey Theme, for Hockey Night in Canada, a song often thought as Canada's second national anthem. She composed in 1968. Claman died on July 17, 2021 from problems caused by dementia in Spain, almost two weeks after her 94th birthday. == References == Category:1927 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Deaths from dementia Category:Disease-related deaths in Spain Category:20th-century composers Category:Canadian composers Category:Canadian pianists Category:Musicians from Vancouver
title: Dolores Claman
